title: Can I give 12th board exam again? - Quora

response.answer_text: yes you can..there is a option.. All about CBSE Improvement Exam Improvement Exam is one of the biggest issues student face when it comes to appearing for JEE. They come across several doubts and queries that require expert assistance. In fact, in the last few days, we have received several questions on our blog. Some of the common queries are what is improvement exam? What is the procedure to give improvement exam? How to apply for improvement exam? Hence, we have decided to dedicate a blog post to all those who want to know everything about CBSE Improvement Exam. CBSE IMPROVEMENT EXAM Out of the total number of candidate who plans to give JEE, some are usually dissatisfied with their score in board exams. There is good news for such students. They can now be able to increase their marks by appearing for Improvement Exam. However, a student needs to give improvement exam in all five subjects to be eligible for JEE. They are not allowed to appear in additional subjects and the subjects, in which they are marked as failed. Students simply need to prepare for theory exam, as their practical marks will be added in the improvement exam results. Students appearing for CBSE Improvement Exam can also appear as private candidates. This means it is not mandatory to attend regular classes/school lectures to appear in the exam. FAQs on CBSE Improvement Exam IMPORTANT POINTS ABOUT CBSE IMPROVEMENT EXAM Only candidates, who had qualified the Secondary School Examination of the CBSE Board, will be eligible to appear for CBSE Improvement Exam.For candidates from other boards, there is NIOS – The National Institute of Open Schooling (working on the concept of On-Demand Examination).Candidates appearing for improvement exam cannot pursue higher studies during this course.Those giving improvement in all subjects can also appear as regular school candidates.Students simply need to prepare for theory exam, as their practical marks will be added in the improvement exam results. If the candidate has failed in practical, he/she need to appear for both theory and practical exam, irrespective of the fact that he/she has already cleared the theory examination.Candidates appearing for CBSE Improvement Exam are issued a new marksheet, reflecting their revised marks.New passing certificate is not issued, since the previous year’s passing certificate is still valid.CBSE Improvement Exam Application Forms are of two types – DISSCE (exclusively for Government Schools in Delhi) and AISSCE (for private schools –All India level).Cost of the CBSE Improvement Exam Application Form is usually INR 10.FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ON CBSE IMPROVEMENT EXAM Question 1 – How many times can I give CBSE Improvement Exam? Answer – Only one attempt in the succeeding year is permitted for improvement exam. Question 2 – In how many subjects, do I need to appear for Improvement Exam? Answer – For JEE, a candidate is required to take up improvement exam in all five (5) subjects. However, for general, candidates can appear in one or more than one subject (s) as per his/her choice. Also, the improvement exam can be taken only in the successive year of passing Class XIIth exam. Questions 3 – Can a candidate simultaneously appear for Improvement as well as Additional Subject Examination? Answer – No, a candidate appearing for Improvement Exam in one or more subjects cannot appear for additional subject examination simultaneously. Question 4 – Will I get passing certificate after clearing the Improvement Exam? Answer – No, only a statement of marks is issued by the board after clearing the CBSE Improvement Exam.. Question 5 – I wish to improve my performance in Class 12th Chemistry and Mathematics subjects. Is it possible? How? Answer – A candidate who has qualified Class 12 th examination of CBSE board may re-appear for improvement of performance in one or more subjects in the main examination in the succeeding year only. The candidate may appear privately, however those re-appearing for all subjects can also appear as regular candidate, if admitted by the school. Question 6 – Is it safe to give CBSE Improvement Exam? Answer – Of course yes! CBSE Improvement Exam is as safe as giving the board exams, since you are actually appearing in CBSE Board Exams. The question papers, exam dates, result will be same as for other regular candidates. You will get a new marksheet issued by CBSE. The improvement marksheet is different from board marksheet and even if you have 2 marksheets with you, the combination of marks of both the marksheets are valid if you are applying for a college. (Please note that some colleges and universities have different policies for improvement exam like BITS). Merits and Demerits of CBSE Improvement Exam Question 7 – How to get CBSE Improvement Exam Form? Answer – If you are a Delhi resident, the application form for CBSE Improvement Exam will be available in nearly all branches of the Syndicate Banks against a payment of INR 10/- If you reside outside Delhi, you can download the application form from the official website of CBSE.
